Now, about that litter box... Keeping it clean and odor-free is a crucial part of cat ownership. Here are some tips to help you maintain a fresh and hygienic litter box:

1. **Scoop, scoop, scoop!**: Remove solid waste daily, and change the litter completely every 7-10 days. This will prevent the buildup of bacteria and odors.
2. **Choose the right litter**: Opt for a high-quality litter that's designed to control odor and moisture. Clumping litter can make scooping easier, while silica gel or natural litters can be more effective at absorbing odors.
3. **Clean the litter box regularly**: Wash the litter box with mild detergent and warm water every 1-2 weeks. Rinse thoroughly to remove any residue.
4. **Use odor-controlling products**: Sprinkle baking soda, white vinegar, or odor-absorbing sprays in the litter box to help neutralize smells.
5. **Provide enough litter boxes**: Have one litter box per cat, plus one extra. This will prevent competition and reduce the likelihood of accidents outside the litter box.
6. **Keep the litter box in a well-ventilated area**: Place the litter box in a spot with good airflow to help reduce odors.
7. **Consider an automated litter box**: If you're short on time or want a low-maintenance solution, consider investing in an automated litter box that scoops and cleans itself.
8. **Monitor Whiskers' behavior**: If you notice Whiskers avoiding the litter box or exhibiting abnormal behavior, it may be a sign of a medical issue or litter box dissatisfaction. Consult with your vet if you're concerned.

Remember, every cat is different, so it may take some trial and error to find the perfect litter box setup for Whiskers. Be patient, and don't hesitate to reach out if you need more advice!
